fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27996].
  {panel}

* Comment on an issue
* Start to mention someone by typing e.g. _@admin_
* When the mentions bar shows up, clear the entered text *fast* (e.g. by using backspace) - the mentions bar will stay some time and not instantly close
* *Bug:* as soon as the mention expression (_@admin_) is removed while the mentions bar is still visible, the error dialog pops up
* Workaround: slowly remove the mentions expression, so that the error bar vanishes, before the @ is removed
fields.summary: Mentions produces JavaScript error dialog in IE9 when clearing entered mentions expression too fast
SAP DefaultVersionManager & CachingVersionStore Optimization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27991].
  {panel}

If I create a custom field of type Select List, then create a new tab on the Default Screen and move the custom field to it, it appears in the tab in Create and Edit screens. The View screen shows the field in the Details section at the top left.

The documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-ConfiguringTabs
has a warning about System fields but not custom fields. With all the UI changes this intended to work in JIRA 5.x?

From the doc page:

"Fields of type 'Date' can only be displayed in the 'Dates' area of the screen, even if they are custom fields.

System fields on the default 'View Issue' screen (e.g. Summary, Security Level, Issue Type, etc.) are fixed and cannot be moved onto a separate tab. However, any other custom fields (except 'Date' fields) that have been added to the 'View Issue' screen can be moved onto a separate tab. 

This restriction only applies to the screen associated with the 'View Issue' operation, i.e. system fields can be moved onto other tabs for screens associated with operations such as 'Create Issue', 'Edit Issue', etc."
fields.summary: Tabs not working in View Screen
SAP Lucene Sorting Optimization - readCounter for Full Table Scans
SAP Lucene Sorting Optimization - IndexReader
SAP Lucene Sorting Optimization - numHits
Configurable Priority in Mail Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27983].
  {panel}

We need JIRA to create some stylesheet that will adapt it's content for mobile devices.
We need to be able to display JIRA dashboard on our mobile device and to change some issue content, assign issue, edit them, etc.
I saw many other issue here related to this one but they are always skipped.
I DON'T want an other app! Only a web page that is adapted to my small mobile device screen.
I think it's an important feature for a 2012 web base product to provide this feature natively. I've already bought JIRA, I don't want to buy something else to to this.
fields.summary: Adapt JIRA stylesheet to support mobile devices
Please make mention that Mobile Safari is not supported

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27972].
  {panel}

When debugging a suspected GreenHopper performance issue in OnDemand, I did some profiling on an instance to get to the root of the problem. It looks as though the Flowdock for JIRA plugin is doing some very expensive PropertySet creation in an IssueEventListener. This might not have been picked up on in regular JIRA usage, as most of the time IssueEvents are fired for only a single issue (create, update, etc). However GreenHopper updates multiple issues at a single time in a loop, and the slowdown caused by this extra code is very noticeable.

OnDemand instances bundle the Flowdock for JIRA plugin by default. Thus this could be a big problem for a lot of customers. Note that I tried to disable the plugin to see if the problem went away, but it still persisted.

Here is the thread profile from New Relic:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27971].
  {panel}

Whilst working on JRADEV-10913 I encountered a bug which I could reproduce only in IE9 (didn't try IE8 yet).

Attached is a dataset which is based on JIRA5.0_QAData.zip in which I created a simple qa-like workflow to help me reproduce the the bug in JRADEV-10913. This, and my lack of experience in setting up workflows, screens, etc, may well be the cause of the issue. However this sort of error should preferably not occur due to user error.

Steps to reproduce:

In IE9: 
- Restore attached data
- Create an issue in the QA project
- Transition the newly created issue to "In Progress" by clicking Workflow -> Start Progress
- Click "QA Time"
- Enter a tester name and submit the form.
-- Please note that sometimes the transition buttons under the Ops Bar do not update. If this occurs then it's certain that there's going to be an SQL error. In this case click Workflows -> Back to In Development
- If no error occurs transition "Back to Development"
- Repeat the above steps alternating tester value from admin to fred and back until an SQL error is displayed as follows:

{quote}
Could not move to history step for #12694: root cause: while inserting: [GenericEntity:OSHistoryStep][id,13052][caller,admin][startDate,2012-04-17 16:19:08.781][status,Not Done][owner,][finishDate,2012-04-17 16:19:32.143][actionId,791][stepId,3][dueDate,null][entryId,12694] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Unique constraint violation: SYS_IDX_107 in statement [INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)]))
{quote}
fields.summary: Cannot transition workflow in IE9. SQL error and data dodginess results.
update Tempo in JOD to version 7.0.3.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27968].
  {panel}

My goal is to create a new issue, taking some of the field values from an existing issue. 

The fields that should be copied are not known at compile time - they are defined by a parameter, say List<OrderableField> or even List<CustomField>.

IssueService.validateCreate() and IssueService.create() accept IssueInputParameters. 

IssueInputParameters allow to:
1. Set system fields through named methods like setPriority() -- not convenient for this task, and does not allow to change custom fields.
2. Set custom field value by passing "String[]" argument -- not sufficient because I can't extract the correct String[] from an issue.
3. Set action input parameters as if they were passed from the form -- ditto, I can't get those parameters from Issue
4. Use setFieldValuesHolder() to provide a map that will be copied during creation operation -- unfortunately, it's of no use, since values stored there are ignored and overridden by the defaults or taken from the action parameters map.

If there was a way to get the correct "action parameters" String[] for a custom field value of a given Issue, that would solve the problem at the minimum level. Unfortunately, the only way to do that, as far as I can see, is to get the Edit HTML for the issue, then parse it and extract form parameters that would be sent over.
fields.summary: There's no way to get a field value from Issue and use it for creating/updating another issue with IssueService
Allow only select project roles to create new labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27965].
  {panel}

I have an issue where I want the following text essentially rendered as it is read:
{noformat}
1) Create new content entry for bundle (type 22) in #__content table
2) Add entry to #__access_bundles table for metadata (not if has variations, request_* can be their default values)
3) Create any variations in #__access_bundle_variations table and link to bundle
4) Create provisioning links #__content_identity_relationships with the context "provisioning" linking the content to an identity representing the target role.
5) ??
6) Profit
{noformat}

What happens normally is as follows:

1) Create new content entry for bundle (type 22) in #__content table
2) Add entry to #__access_bundles table for metadata (not if has variations, request_* can be their default values)
3) Create any variations in #__access_bundle_variations table and link to bundle
4) Create provisioning links #__content_identity_relationships with the context "provisioning" linking the content to an identity representing the target role.
5) ??
6) Profit


Notice how the second line is italicised incorrectly. Ideally I want to be able to tell JIRA not to go all fancy on the text but it isn't pre-formatted text so I don't want the ugly text box that comes with that just because JIRA's formatter is being silly. I just want to tell it to disable the formatter but not switch to preformatted text mode (e.g. wrap like normal text).
fields.summary: Option to disable formatter but not wrap in frame
Show the aggregate collection of groups that a user is a member of across all directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27959].
  {panel}

When using the config tool to change the port number of Tomcat or changing the tomcat port number in server.xml, the base URL still points to the old port number.  

Steps to replicate : 
1. Go to system menu and click on General Configuration 
2. Check the base URL and note the port number.  
3. Go to config tool using config.bat and change the webserver port number from the current one (eg. 8080) to let say 80
4. Save config and restart JIRA
5. Go to system menu and click on General Configuration 
6. The base URL still points to the old port number of 8080.  

Because of this, the links in Activity Stream still refer to the old port number.

Workaround is to edit the configuration to modify the port number.
fields.summary: Base URL's port number does not change after changing in server.xml file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27957].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The context for custom fields can be deleted without confirmation.

h3. Suggested Solution
In the delete button highlighted in the image below, add a confirmation that the existing data of the context will be deleted.
!configure-custom-field.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
This is a serious concern on the reliability as it's possible to delete something without confirmation. There is a chance to click in the cog icon to edit the context and click on the bin and delete it accidentally.
If you have for example a custom field with multiple preset values, if the context is deleted, you must recreate the context and edit all issues accordingly.
!custom-field-no-context.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Removing a Custom Field Context should require confirmation
update Tempo in JOD to version 7.0.2.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27952].
  {panel}

Modify JIRA's *User Name Menu > Online Help* link so that it points to the configured home page in JIRA documentation spaces on Atlassian's documentation site.

Please modify this online help link so that it points to:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-050/ (which currently resolves to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA - via the redirect implemented on https://docs.atlassian.com, which in turn leads to the home page for this 'JIRA' space)

instead of:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-050/JIRA+Documentation (which currently resolves to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Documentation - again via the redirect implemented on https://docs.atlassian.com)

As part of a documentation consistency strategy, we recently renamed the JIRA Documentation home page from *JIRA Documentation* to *JIRA Documentation Home*, which resulted in JIRA's *Online Help* link breaking (see JRA-27888).

The space home page (which can be configured at the following space admin-accessible URL of any Confluence site http://<confluence-site>/spaces/editspace.action?key=SPACEKEY) can be changed to the name of whatever page in the space you want and when it is, any page that goes to the following URL:

* http://<confluence-site>/display/SPACEKEY/

will be interpreted/resolved/redirected by Confluence itself to:

* http://<confluence-site>/display/SPACEKEY/Name+of+Space+Home+Page (which is the one configured at the 'editspace' URL above).

Hence, my reason for requesting that the Online Help link in the product is fixed itself (as mentioned at the top of this comment), since it gives the tech writers flexibility over changing the name of the space home page (without external links pointing to that page breaking).
fields.summary: Modify JIRA's "User Name Menu > Online Help" link so that it points to the configured home page in JIRA documentation spaces on Atlassian's documentation site.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27936].
  {panel}

At the moment in REST, you can only update/edit a field in an issue if it is part of the edit screen for that project/issuetype.

It is desirable to be able to opt into editing any field in the field config for that project/issuetype.

For example, a {{skipScreenCheck=true}} query param. You should also be able to ask for the full edit-meta for non-screen fields with {{skipScreenCheck=true}}.

One usecase is exemplified by JRA-27929, where the "lables" field is not in the edit screen config, but is in fact editable on the view-issue screen anyway.
fields.summary: Add ability to use setSkipScreenCheck() when updating an issue via REST
Locking of phone not working after immersing the phone in water

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27926].
  {panel}

The Issue Type Sub-Task is not listed in the Issue Type when user try to create Sub-Task in Gadget. 

Steps to reproduce:
# go to any gadget. For example Filter List gadget
# click on the Tools icon
# select Create Sub-Task as per screenshot CreateSubTask1.png
# Sub-Task issue type is not listed as per screenshot CreateSubtask2.png even though the Sub-Task feature was enabled
# creating Sub-Task is not a problem via the view Issue Screen

This is *not affecting JIRA 4.4.4.* , but affecting JIRA 5.0.x


As a workaround, user can right click on 'create sub-task' link on the gadget and open it is a new tab.
fields.summary: Create Sub-Task From Gadget Does Not List Sub-Task Issue Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27918].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Log in as a user that's a member of a group with "Manage Group Filter Subscriptions" global permission (by default only "jira-developers").
# Search for a filter, click "Subscribe".
# In the Recipients dropdown choose "Personal Subscription".
# In the next screen, click "Run now".

When the email is flushed from the mail queue, the following error appears in the logs:

{code:none}
2012-04-18 23:46:07,388 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem owner: [...] /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem] Group 'Personal Subscription' referenced in subscription '10004' of filter '10300' does not exist.
{code}

And the user never receives the email.

If you subscribe when you're _not_ a member of a group with "Manage Group Filter Subscriptions" global permission, everything works as expected and the subscription email is delivered.
fields.summary: "Personal Subscription" filter subscriptions never send - tries to send to non-existent group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27917].
  {panel}

I frequently observe this:

- Perform any query
- Click on the first issue to view it. Top right corner will have the two triangles for navigating to next/previous issue.
- I usually keep the mouse at the "next" triangle and click it to move on to the next issue, then briefly read the issue (e.g. when reviewing recently added ones)

What is annyoing is that the position of the triangles slightly changes, depending on whether the issue is long (and a scrollbar appears at the right border). If this happens, I need to reposition the mouse. If the scrollbar vanishes for the next issue (because it is short), I have to reposition the mouse again.

Even worse, it happens easily to click on the "Return to search" link which slides under the mouse pointer in the latter case.

Usability would be greatly improved if the arrows could stay at the same position independent of whether a scroll bar is currently shown or not.
fields.summary: Browsing Search Results: Position of Arrows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27915].
  {panel}

Hi,

There is our customer's report.

This problem occurs only in the specific condition.
It is that a language mode setting of user profile is language(s)/locale(s) using non-ascii characters (e.g. Japanese, Chinese, etc).

If setting English language mode, the downloaded excel filename is "Time Tracking Report.xls".

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa
Ricksoft support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27899].
  {panel}

In the global road map, one cannot switch between projects. This is, however, possible in the personal road map.

As there seems no obvious reason why switching projects cannot or should not be available for global road map view, please consider adding similar functionality there, too.

Currently, I have to use the following clumsy workaround:
- From global RM, switch to personal RM.
- Use the project drop list to switch to another project
- Switch back to the global RM.
fields.summary: Road Map: Global: Can't switch between projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27898].
  {panel}

Trying to @mention people on JAC is so slow that its kinda pointless.

Problem number 1 is that it takes 5 seconds to do a  look up at the moment

Problem number 2 is one of UX.  There is no easy way to see that a request is happening and hence you keep typing and hence it cancels the request and hence you get no results so you remove some of the typing thinking it doesnt work and then there are still no results and... you get the picture.

Its basically makes you think that nothing is going to happen.  We need to tighten the UX up so that you can "know" that a request is in flight after a longish time (say 2 seconds)
fields.summary: @Mentions are unusable on JAC and I would suggest other slow systems
Enable conversion of issue to subtask via REST

Analyse JIRA performances and Identify bottlenecks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27872].
  {panel}

This problem (JRA-1844) has been known since 2003.

When you add an attachment, you are asked for a comment. Most users assume the comment will be associated and displayed with the attachment, like a caption on a picture.

However, in the Comment tab panel (which is the default, in our installation at least), the comments and the attachments are displayed separately - there is no way to tell from a comment which attachment it refers to, nor even that it refers to any attachment! And conversely there is no way to see, from the list of attachments, the comment that was entered with each.

It also means that you have comments that don't make sense (e.g. "stacktrace") because they were written as if they were a label for the attachment rather than a stand-alone comment.

Attached screenshots on this issue show the orphaned comments and attachments.

The "Activity" tab panel now shows the association between comments and attachments. But who, faced with the above situation, would guess that they needed to click on "Activity" in order to solve the problem?

Requested fixes, in order of preference:

1) In Comments tab panel, for each attachment show the associated comment (possibly a collapsed, expandable summary); and for each comment that has an attachment, show the filename as a link to the attachment. OR,

2) For each attachment comment and attachment in the Comments tab panel, show some indicator of an association (e.g. an icon), a tooltip that tells the user there is an associated comment/attachment, and a clear instruction on how to find out what the associated comment/attachment is (e.g. click on the Activity tab at the top of the Activity section of the page). OR,

3) When asking the user to enter a comment, notify them prominently that there will be no association displayed (in the default panel) between their comment and the thing they're commenting on, so they need to make the association explicit in the comment (e.g., "Attaching foo.txt, the error log from bar.exe").
fields.summary: comments and attachments need to be visually associated in Comment tab pane.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27869].
  {panel}

During internal efforts to improve our full re-indexing time we found a huge performance boost by disabling the MySQL query cache during the indexing period. This dropped our re-index time from 45 minutes to ~23 minutes. This figures above were obtained by running the re-index 5 times with and without the query cache enabled.

While our testing involved disabling the MySQL query cache completely in the server, I believe the same effect can obtained by having Jira pre-fix all indexing {{SELECT}} queries to the DB with "{{SQL_NO_CACHE}}"
[http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/query-cache-in-select.html]

The Jira re-indexing process can detect the fact that MySQL is being used via JDBC, and use the "{{SQL_NO_CACHE}}" prefix accordingly.

Please note our testing was done on MySQL 5.1, so I can't speak to the benefits of this change on 5.5/5.6
Also in case it's not obvious, this fix will only benefit those users who already have the MySQL query cache enabled.

FWIW, the same principle above may apply to other DB-intensive scenarios where little to no queries will be the same. So it's possible bulk operations and the integrity checker may benefit from this change also.

All testing performed on Jira 4.4.4
fields.summary: Disable query caching during re-indexing operations (MySQL)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27868].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}


*Original issue description:*


This ticket is a carryover from JRA-24213. In the related ticket, we were able to analyse and implemented the following features in JIRA 5.0.3:

{quote}
1. Migrating whole directories:
1.1 Internal to Internal with Delegated Auth
1.2 Internal with Delegated Auth to Internal
{quote}

However it did not cover the following migration features:
{quote}
2. Migrating users from one directory to another:
2.1 Individually
2.2 All users in a directory
{quote}
It is an essential feature to some of our customer who use  user directories other than Delegated Auth and the resolution in JRA-24213 doesn't solve their problem.

h3. Workaround

Please review [Migrating Users between User Directories|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+Users+between+User+Directories] as it provides some alternative options for migrating users between directories.
fields.summary: Migrating users from one directory to another (part 2)
Plugin actions can't share the same simple class name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27864].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in the announcement banner. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] in the announcement banner. 

We would like to come up with a compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the announcement banner for in a secure way. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using the announcement banner. Please comment on this issue to let us know how you have been using HTML in the announcement banner.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27854].
  {panel}

When viewing an issue with a Multi User Picker custom field, the values are sorted by full name. However, when editing, the values are sorted by Username instead. This causes problems in systems where the usernames are significantly different than full names. There's no easy way to determine which username matches which full name. Because the sorting is not consistent, you can't simply note the position of the full name on the view screen and then remove that username on the edit screen because the users are not guaranteed to be in the same order.

An example of this would be three users:

||Full Name||Username
|Brian Curnow|bcurnow
|Just Some User|auser
|Test User 1|testuser1

If you add these users to the Multi User custom field, in view they will be sorted in the following order:

* Brian Curnow
* Just Some User
* Test User 1

However, if you edit the issue, the values will be sorted in the following order:

* auser
* bcurnow
* testuser1

The sorting should be consistent in all views, either always sort by username or always sort by full name.

An alternative, and I can open an additional issue if necessary, is to change the rendering of the edit view so it works like component. Where each value is rendered as a bubble containing the full name with a X in the corner that will remove the value.
fields.summary: Fix sorting of users for the Multi User custom field type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27839].
  {panel}

h3.Symptoms
When exporting all fields to Excel (XLS) the "Business Value" and "Story Points" are missing.
Even when adding them manually to the columns (Tools > Configure Columns) this won't work.
It also occurs with or without the presence of data on these fields.

h3.Steps to reproduce
* Go to "Issues";
* Click on "Search";
* Click on "Views";
* Select "Excel (All fields)"

The generated XLS file won't export the "Business Value" and "Story Points" columns.

h3.Diagnosis
The behaviour seems to be because the custom fields "Story Points" or "Business Value" are not valid for at least one of the issues which are returned by the search.

h3.Workaround
h4.Option 1: Modify the query to include only issues which have "Story Points" or "Business Value"
Modify the query to filter only issues for which the custom fields "Story Points" or "Business Value" are valid by appending the following to the query:
{code}
AND ("Story Points" is EMPTY or "Story Points" is not EMPTY)
{code}
or
{code}
AND ("Business Value" is EMPTY or "Business Value" is not EMPTY)
{code}

h4.Option 2: Add "Story Points" and/or "Business Value" to all issue types and projects
Note that this could have global impact on your JIRA since it affects configuration for all issue types and projects.
# Go to JIRA Administration > Issues > Custom Fields.
# Scroll down to "Story Points" and from the gear wheel icon, click on Configure.
# For "Choose applicable issue types", select "Any issue type" or choose all issue types which might be returned as part of the search.
# For "Choose applicable context", select "Global context" or choose specific projects that are included in the search.
# Press "Modify" to save the configuration

The workarounds are thanks to this [thread on Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/100693/story-points-not-showing-up-in-issue-navigator-or-export-but-shows-up-in-configure-columns].
fields.summary: "Business Value" and "Story Points" are not exported when going through Views > Excel (All fields).
Add DueDate to the fields supported by the CHANGED operator

Hi,

There are files in JIRA like {{/opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/ui/issue-view.css}} and issue-table.css and several others that are not used anymore because of the .less files (issue-view.less) available. I believe these files are just left over and are not loaded at all.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27833].
  {panel}

In our installation of JIRA 4.4.5 the jira.issue.action.order is set to ascending.  When the issue order toggle control is used to change the action order in the UI (to descending), and the issue is subsequently updated, the action order reverts back to ascending.  This behavior (I believe) is a departure from previous versions, where the selected issue action order would persist, at least for the session.

It would be nice if the issue action order selected by the user would persist, at least for the session. Ideally, it would be swell if control of this behavior could be delegated to individual users, via a preference setting.

Further, when issue activities are collapsed, they appear expanded if a new activity is added. It would be great if this setting could be made to stick, i.e if a user collapses activities, they stay that way until the user expands them.

Thanks for your consideration.

Chris
fields.summary: jira issue action order and display behavior

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27820].

When importing a custom field of type Project Picker, the mapping requires the project ID (number).
It would be nice to have an auto-complete with the list of projects, in order to use the project's display name.
Or maybe use the project's key.
Now, when importing and providing the display name, we get the following error:

2012-04-09 08:44:33,169 ERROR - An error occurred while attempting to import value '<project name>' into the Custom Field 'Target Project'.
com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Project Id is not a number '<project name>'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27813].
  {panel}

I think this is a pervasive problem. Generally much worse than SOAP APIs provided. Some APIs are worse than others. Lets use a simple REST API as an example of the problem. Voting api - http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id162079.

bq. 404: Returned if the user cannot vote for any reason. (The user is the reporter, the user does not have permission to vote, voting is disabled in the instance, the issue does not exist, etc.)

So what is the reason?
# user is reporter - I suppose the API user can get the issue and see if the current user is the reporter
# user does not have permission (to the issue?  or no permission to vote?) - I suppose in this case, trying to get the issue will answer the first question. Not sure about how to find out if the the user has permission to vote
# voting is disabled - how could one figure that out
# issue does not exist - get issue API again would answer that
# user has already voted - not listed in the documentation text, but also gives 404 

Also, why would one expect a *404 - not found* like exception for some of the reasons listed?

The bottom line is the API user has to go through various other actions to figure out what the problem is and sometimes cannot even narrow it down.
fields.summary: Poor error reporting from REST APIs
Internationalisation CustomFields Easily?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27811].

Hi All,

we use create and link plugin and a question arose due to a JIRA instance migration. There is a collection of projects where the developers use to link an issue to several issues at the same time. But they do it manually, so there is an Issue-A and they create Issue-B, Issue-C and Issue-D in different projects and then they link these issues to Issue-A.

Is the Create and link plugin able to link an issue to more than 1 issues at the same time?

Best regards,

Rumi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27800].
  {panel}

Another error with in-comments mentions, this time to do with Wiki Style Renderer.

h5. Steps to Recreate

# Disable Wiki Style Renderer for comments/description/et all.
# Mentioning @user when they are not a watcher, reporter or assignee does not render the WML. See {{Watching.jpg}}.
# Mentioning @user when they *are* a watcher, reporter or assignee renders the WML. See {{Not_Watching.jpg}}.

I believe this is caused by different templates being used for the two actions. It would seem the correct behaviour is not to render the WML as the renderer is disabled for the comments field in this example.

h5. Workaround

Configure the [Wiki Style Renderer|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Renderers#ConfiguringRenderers-WikiStyleRenderer].
fields.summary: In comments mentions when Wiki Markup is disabled
Mention email notification does not contain issue key in subject line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27797].
  {panel}

Project names are mutable. Project Keys are immutable. If you have queries based on a project and you then change the project name all existing queries are now broken.

For example, I had a project called "roadmap" and had queries built for it (i.e. "project=roadmap AND ...") to be used within confluence pages. We needed to add another project called "X roadmap". After noticing my lack of forethought on the naming of "roadmap" I changed the project name to "Y roadmap" which in turn broke all existing confluence pages.

Just think it would be easy to translate project names to keys in the tool itself.

Thanks.
fields.summary: JQL should internally translate project name to project key
